summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel and an Office Services Supervisor regarding the scheduling of evidence transport and a defense review for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The evidence is to be moved to 500 Pearl Street for Maxwell's defense team to view, with arrangements targeting the week of April 12, 2021.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent is coordinating the scheduling of evidence transport and a defense review for Ghislaine Maxwell's case, initiating the email chain to arrange a visit to the Bronx and transport to 500 Pearl.

persons.name: Office Services Supervisor (OSS) OS-58 (Evidence) New York Field Office
persons.context: The OSS for evidence is responding to coordinate the arrangement of evidence transport to 500 Pearl for defense review, offering to call to finalize details.

keyFacts: The FBI was arranging for evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to be transported to 500 Pearl Street for defense review.
The evidence transport and defense viewing were scheduled for the week of April 12, 2021.
The correspondence involves coordination between an FBI Special Agent from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk and an Office Services Supervisor for evidence.
The document references a prior evidence question regarding the Bronx and transport, indicating evidence was stored in the Bronx.
The email chain shows procedural steps in preparing for Maxwell's defense team to review evidence as part of legal proceedings.
